channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.description:
Report X-2025041569

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-28
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=412680043560 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1197 CLASS=30 QTY UOM=Liquid - Liter PSN TEXT=Extracts, liquid PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=10 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=10 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. 1 Overpack box containing UN 3082 @10L and UN1197 @ 10L. UN 3082 was the only substance that leaked (dented chime on the bottom (UN Spec marks not documented). There were also 3 aluminum bottles (non-hazardous) Wormwood Oil, Civette Synth, Methyl Aceto Acetate.

item.title: Report E-2025050068
item.description:
Report E-2025050068

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-11T01:13:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-18
  • City: WEST BROOKFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 135150
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 18, 2024, at approximately 5:50 PM, a release of an estimated 100 gallons of spent petroleum-based solvent occurred at 224 East Main Street (Route 9) in West Brookfield, Massachusetts. Safety-Kleen Systems, Inc. (SKS). A Locus Map depicting the site location is attached to this report. The transporter conducted a transfer of spent (i.e. used) solvent from an indoor above ground storage tank (AST) to the truck. The pump hose connection failed and disconnected from the truck, releasing spent solvent to the asphalt pavement. A portion of the released solvent flowed off the pavement affecting an unpaved embankment. The employee placed the available absorbent pads upon the spilled material and notified the company Emergency Operations Center of the release at 6:31 PM. The call was immediately transferred to a manager. A Site Sketch showing the release area is included in the attachment. In response to the release, the emergency response team from the company was dispatched to conduct an Immediate Response Action (IRA) that included cleaning the impacted pavement and the removal of up to 150 cubic yards of solvent impacted soil. The cargo tank motor vehicle and itâ€™s components did not fail. The hose connection failed at the point between the above ground stationary storage tank and the loading pump at the suction inlet connection to the pump. The connection levers failed and the hose became separated from the pump causing the release.

  • Description: Michael Walker, 086 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN1814 spill on the trailer floor and yard. Michael Walker advised the pallet stacked with jugs not in cases. Michael Walker stated the pallet was forced under a beam, and when the forklift operator pulled the pallet out the jug s fell resulting in the spill. Michael Walker advised it appears the freight was already leaking before attempting to move the freight. Safety advised Michael Walker due to the spill be hazardous and on the yard, Safety will contact CURA for remediation. Kailee Mason with CURA was contacted for reme diation.

item.description:
Report E-2025050464

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: BATTLE CREEK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 22, 2025, one (1) 2,222-pound super-sack of sodium chlorate powder was ripped by a bolt in transit and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the site. The crew patched the supersack with tape and shrink wrap for further handling by R+L. SET personnel utilized hand tools to collect all released powder as well as any miscellaneous clean up debris in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050466
item.description:
Report E-2025050466

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: NEENAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 22, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1993 was damaged by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and two (2) pallets. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Valley Environmental Response (VER) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer. The crew also broke down the two (2) impacted pallets for disposal. Two (2) UN1993-impacted pallets, all granular absorbents, debris, and PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) cubic yard box. One (1) empty 5-gallon pail of UN1993 was collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking paper bag containing hazardous product, Maleic Anhydride. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimate 1lb release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4â€™ x 4â€™ area as a result of forklift puncture. The contractor swept the released product and containerized into one 55-gallon DF along with the one punctured bag of product for waste disposal. The rest of the product was re-palletized and will ship on to the Consignee. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Description: XPO-logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking plastic jerrican containing hazardous product, Caustic Potash. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5-ounce release onto the wooden pallet in a 2â€™ x 2â€™ area as a result of improper packing â€“ loose caps. The contractor applied oil dry to the release and used absorbent pads to clean-up the pallet. One 55-gallon DF containing the one leaking jerrican and one 55-gallon DF containing the impacted absorbents and PPE were generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 21, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of glyclol ether had a loose cap and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the top of the tote and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew tightened the cap on the tote, then utilized granular absorbents, absorbent pads, and hand tools to remediate the tote and trailer interior. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: Holly Thede, Operations Supervisor, called Safety to report a spill in trailer 570508 involving UN3378, Sodium Carbonate Peroxyhydrate, Class 5.1, Packing Group II. Holly stated that the substance appeared to be a white powder located on top of the lids of the pails. She mentioned that she could not see any visible damage to the pails, as they were wrapped in plastic. However, it appeared that some of the lids had shifted, causing a few to become loose or pop off. Holly estimated that the pails were approximately 55 lbs each, and that there was about 8 ounces of the white powder on the lids.~~ CURA was called to assist with the spill in the trailer.

The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing one can of paint. The lid of the can appeared dislodged, resulting in spillage. The cause was unknown. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum awaiting amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2025051546
item.description:
Report X-2025051546

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: WEST BRIDGEWATER
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Trailer has been loading since Friday night and was just discovered to have a pail on the bottom corner of a pallet that is leaking adhesives. The adhesive seems to have oozed out of the pail and spread under the pallet and seeped through the floor boards of the trailer but then coagulated into stal actites under the trailer before hitting the yard. The operations supervisor was unsure if any actually hit the yard. The pail appears to have failed under the weight of the freight above it but the operations supervisor advised that he did not see any other damage however the pallet is wrapped and some of the adhesive oozed out under the wrap so it may have been the top cover of the pail that failed. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation and to make sure nothing hit the yard.~~Called CURA and spoke with Candice who advised a crew will be sent out and will check the yard and p ower wash if needed.

item.description:
Report E-2025050421

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS regarding a puncture leaking 05PAIL containing hazardous product, Step Down. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 7' x 6' area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 7' x 6' area as a result of a forklift puncture. The contractor neutralized the release using citric acid and applied oil dry. One 55-gallon DF of waste was generated containing the damaged pail and the impacted absorbents and PPE. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Description: On 5/17/2025 at approximately 0345, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5243686 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 5 fiberboard boxes; each appeared to contain 2 metal cans. The package with the tracking number ending in - 2823, was damaged due from the spillage of one of its cans. The package was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • City: ELLENWOOD

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 16, 2025, four (4) 32-ounce cans of Weld-On C-65 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbent pads and degreaser to remove the released product from the dock floor. The damaged cans of product and all impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050410
item.description:
Report E-2025050410

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-16
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 16, 2205, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and two (2) pallets. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EX) to remediate the site. EX personnel patched the damaged drum and placed it in one (1) 95-gallon overpack. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The impacted pallets were dismantled and containerized within one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: On 5/15/2025 at approximately 1345, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 393838 at the ramp facility in Fort Worth, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment is a 55 lb. plastic drum containing slow-dissolving chlorine tablets. Using the active ingredient list on the drum, Dangerous Goods Administration obtained a generic safety data sheet that classified the commodity as UN2468. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held for an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2025050424
item.description:
Report E-2025050424

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: KELLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 15, 2025, at 1910 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Keller, Texas regarding the release of ABC FORMULA 300. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 5.0 gallons of ABC FORMULA 300 (UN1760, 8, III) from (1) 275-gallon poly tote onto the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to the cage rubbing against the plastic tote bladder and creating a hole in the tote, impacting a 26â€™ x 6â€™ area of the trailer floor. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was neutralized then cleaned with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors transferred the remaining product from the damaged tote into a new, clean tote and proceeded to shred the damaged tote. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DFs which were taken off-site by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Description: On May 15, 2025, at 1215 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Washington, MO regarding the release of Ethanol. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 275.0 gallons of Ethanol (UN1170, 3, II) from (1) 270-gal poy tote and (1) 5-gal plastic pail onto asphalt and the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to a load shift as the tote slid into a pallet, impacting the trailer floor and a 1â€™ x 2â€™ area of asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Damaged pails of product were overpacked in a flex bin by the contractors to leave with the consignee and send back to the shipper. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DGs which were taken off-site by the contractor pending proper disposal.

Report E-2025050395

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 15, 2025, one (1) 1-gallon glass bottle of ethylene dichloride in one (1) box was crushed due to improper freight handling and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the fiberboard box. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew collected the damaged box in one (1) 5-gallon pail and the damaged bottle of product in one (1) additional 5-gallon pail.

The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 14, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Activ-8 was punctured by nails and released approximately thirty-five (35) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pallets, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbent pads and cleansers to remediate the site. Granular absorbents and hand tools were also utilized for the impacted pavement. The impacted pallet was containerized in one (1) cubic yard supersack, while the damaged drum of product was placed in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. All impacted absorbents and debris were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The damaged container was placed into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

The DG agent also looked up the SDS to confirm that the contents were DG. Package is being held.

item.title: Report E-2025050241
item.description:
Report E-2025050241

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: HORSE CAVE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13, 2025, four (4) 5-gallon pails of adhesives (UN1133) were crushed in transit and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer floor, trailer exterior, concrete beneath the trailer, and adjacent pails. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the site. The crew utilized cleaners and absorbents pads as well as granular absorbents and hand tools to remove the released product from the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pails were containerized in one (1) supersack. Any other adhesive-impacted pails were containerized in one (1) additional supersack.

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13, 2025, at 0952 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Newton, NC regarding the release of ShrinkPET HSPRO YELLOW. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1-gallon of ShrinkPET HSPRO YELLOW (UN1210, 3, II) from (8) 1-gallon steel pails onto the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to a load shift, impacting a 3â€™ x 4â€™ area of the trailer floor and damaging a 55-gallon DM of product. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned with absorbent pads and the proper PPE. The 55-gallon damaged DM of product was placed into an 85-gallon DM overpack and all other waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DMs. All waste was taken off-site by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Description: On May 13, 2025, four (4) 5-gallon pails of resin solution were crushed in transit due to improper loading and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized granular absorbents, absorbent pads, cleaning agents, and hand tools to remediate the trailer interior. All spent absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums, and the damaged pails were containerized in two (2) additional drums for disposal.

  • Description: On May 13, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3098 was punctured and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer, freight, and terminal asphalt lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew containerized the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon metal overpack and utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted areas. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. On May 16, 2025, the crew returned to the site due to the chemical eating away at the overpack previously used. ES personnel placed the damaged drum of product into one (1) new 95-gallon poly drum. The old 85-gallon overpack was taken for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025050964
item.description:
Report X-2025050964

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-12
  • City: NEW BERN
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 12th at approximately 11::00 AM, FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration was notified by station management of a leaking package at New Bern, NC station, tracking number 447020814580. Upon investigation, the package contained a leaking battery, Deka Master Marine Deep Cycle. The package did not have any dangerous goods marking/labeling. FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration searched for the safety data sheet for the battery. Based upon the information provided, this appears to be classified as UN2794 Batteries, Wet, Filled With Acid. The spill was contained in a salvage drum by management and then advised by FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration to hold the package pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2025050233
item.description:
Report E-2025050233

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-12
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 12, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon pails of paint were forked and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pallet, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Absorbent pads, granular absorbents, and hand tools were utilized to remove the released paint from the surfaces. The impacted pallet was dismantled. All impacted absorbents and the pallet were containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 250-gallon plastic tote containing hazardous product, Zirca-Sil 18. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1-ounce release onto the top of the tote in a 3â€™ x 3â€™ area as a result of a loose cap and missing bung cap. The contractor used absorbent pads to clean-up the release and tightened the cap. One 30-gallon DF of waste was generated containing the impacted absorbents. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025050221
item.description:
Report E-2025050221

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-12
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 12ft-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and concrete dock and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to a forklift puncturing two (2) 5-gallon jerricans. Hepaco personnel removed all the freight from the trailer. Most of the product was at the nose of the trailer. The pH test revealed it was 0. Soda ash was deployed to neutralize the affected areas. The new pH reading for the trailer was 8-9. Three (3) 55-gallon poly drums were used to containerize empty jugs, impacted cardboard, bolts, fasteners, plastic wrap, absorbent pads, and PPE. Contractor personnel had to return to site because the terminal reported one of the drums reacted. All the drums were moved outside and filled with water under the supervision of the fire department. While Hepaco personnel waited for the temperature of the drums to cool down, they clean-up the affected concrete on the dock. The contents were contained into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and filled with water. After the temperature of the drums lowered, the terminal manager and chief of fire department declared the site was safe to leave. The generated waste was staged onsite and will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2025050882

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-11
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: **POSSIBLE RELEASE**A pallet of plastic jerricans arrived to 155 and it was discovered that one of the containers may have leaked a small amount from the top at some point. The operations manager advised that it appeared that a cap may have been loose on one of the containers causing a small amount to drip down the side of the container and onto the pallet it was on, but advised that the portion that dripped out was dry by the time it was discovered and only dripped onto the pallet it was on and did not get onto the trailer floor or any other surfaces and the cap appears sealed now. The operat ions manager advised there was nothing on scene to clean and just wanted to mention it. Safety advised if they notice any liquid leaking from the container to call back and a crew would be sent out to clean it up.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO ONE LEAKING AIR PACKAGE IN A UPS EXPRESS PACK. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A SINGLE 14 OUNCE CAN OF COFFEE MATE COLD FOAM CREAMER LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THIS PACKAGE WAS DROPPED OFF IN NEW JERSEY USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 45R4A5, ZEROLINK CLOVER HILL VINEYA, 9850 NEWTON RD, BREINIGSVILLE PA 18031-1808. THE ACCOUNT USAGE IS SUSPECTED TO BE UNAUTHORIZED.

item.description:
Report E-2025050207

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 9, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the wooden pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents, cleansers, and hand tools to remove the spent product. The damaged pail was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and all spent absorbents and debris were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025050519
item.description:
Report E-2025050519

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 00:11 AM ET, Morgan with UDV contacted the call center to request assistance with a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Henderson, CO. The spill consists of approximately 10 ounces of Infused, which released from a 1 275-gallon plastic tote due to a loose lid that caused the product to slosh around and spill on the top of the tote and on the trailer floor. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist, as this is a corrosive liquid inside of a tote. No SDS could be located for this product. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-ounces of UN3264 Infused product released from a 275-gallon plastic tote to the top of the tote and an area of the wooden trailer floor (4â€™x4â€™) due to improper packaging & a loose cap. The crew used absorbents to collect and containerize the spill and generated (1) 5-pound poly drum containing impacted absorbents and PPE. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2025050216

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-08
  • City: ATHENS
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR TRANSPORTATION LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 11000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver noticed dripping from the bottom valve of a tote in transit. The driver attempted to isolate the leak by using plug n dike. A spill response contractor was called. The spill response contractor transferred the contents of the tote with the leaking valve, into another tote. The spill response contractor also cleaned up the material that leaked from the bottom valve of the tote. In total, 22 pounds of product leaked from the bottom valve on the tote. Only a small amount of material leaked out from the trailer, majority of the material was contained to the trailer. The location of incident listed in #7 was the closest address to where the leak occurred, so that is why it was used as the location of the incident.

  • City: SANGER

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 8, 2025, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN3378 was ripped during shipment due to improper securement and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the impacted site. ES&H personnel containerized the damaged bag of product into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew utilized a vacuum unit to collect all released material into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2025051324

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/7/2025 at approximately 1145, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 294822 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of 6 fiberboard boxes, each containing several mobile phones. Each box yielded an estimated gross weight of 56.5 kg, which leads to the presumption that the packages should have possibly been classified as fully regulated UN 3481 Section I. None of the packages appear to be prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations as they do not display the required markings, labeling, packaging or paperwork. The shipment will be set for disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 7, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of cherry extract was forked and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the dock floor. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. LSH then performed a tote transfer to one (1) new 330-gallon tote.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: WEST MIDDLESEX
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that an estimated two (2) cups of material were released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The released material impacted the bottom of the drum due to unloading/loading of freight. Clean Harbors removed the drum from the trailer and placed it into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The waste drum was staged onsite at the terminal. The ESTES terminal manager approved of the clean-up before Clean Harbors departed the site. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2025051012

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP, BY THE RESPONDER ON. THE PACKAGE CAME FROM DOOR 1 ON THE A UNLOAD. IN THE DMP, THE PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN ONE, 5 GALLON, PLASTIC JERRICAN, OF ACCEMULTA MFD-5-A, BEING SHIPPED AS A CORROSIVE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE (UN2796, SULFURIC ACID SOLUTION, 8, II, OVERPAC USED, 1 PLASTIC JERRICAN X 20L). WHEN INSPECTED THE JERRICAN WAS FOUND TO HAVE A SMALL CRACK IN THE BODY OF THE CAN, WHICH ALLOWED A SMALL AMOUNT OF THE ACID TO LEAK ONTO THE OUTSIDE CARTON. ALL MATERIAL WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum along with a damaged pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2025050511

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Trailer arrived to 003 and when the trailer was opened it was discovered that there were pails scattered across the rear of the trailer. The box the containers were in shifted in transit. The containers did not appear to be significantly damaged but there were small piles of powder scattered around the floor of the trailer. Safety advised CURA would be contacted for remediation. Crews located approximately 1/4 cup of UN3378 released to the trailer floor. There were no damaged containers and crews determined product had spilled due to load shift. Hand tools were utilized to remove free-standing product. All waste collected and containerized into one (1) five-gallon pail for disposal. Zachary Branstetter approved of clean up.

item.description:
Report E-2025050500

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1425 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BGB. It was reported that an estimated 12) 2.5-gallon cardboard boxes w/ plastic bladder bags of UN1791 "Marketguard 121" released due to shipper error. The release impacted trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 gallons UN1791 Marketguard 121 released to the trailer floor impacting 5â€™x5â€™ area due to load shift. The contractors cleaned the release with oil dri and generated (10) drums of waste (9) consisting of cardboard and damaged product and the 10th drum containing PPE. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2025050665

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: Havre
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 08:30 MT - PPRX 171283 released half a cup of crude oil on shell body. No ground impact. Track 2330. Hazmat pool placed underneath car as a precaution. Contractor assistance needed to clean the car body. BNSF Hazmat responder - responded and identified the sample line valve was partially open and the plug was loose contributing to the release. The plug was secured and the valve was closed. Olympus Technical cleaned the car body so the car could continue in transportation.

  • City: MATTESON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 6, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a forklift and released approximately 20-gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted areas. All spent absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed in one (1) 85-gallon overpack for future disposal.

item.description:

  • City: COLOGNE
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN COLOGNE, GERMANY, TWO AIR PACKAGES FROM GERMANY TO AUSTRIA WERE FOUND TO CONTAIN CONTENTS CLASSIFIED AS DANGEROUS GOODS. BOTH PACKAGES HAVE WHITE AVERY TYPE LABELS COVERING 1.4G EXPLOSIVE DIAMOND LABELS. THE DIAMOND LABELS ARE FULLY COVERED BUT BLEEDING THROUGH THE WHITE LABELS. EACH BOX CONTAINS FLASH REPORT NO 2 AND FLASH REPORT NO 1 PYROTECHNICS. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IN THE SHIPMENT IS 1Z02W93E0497696839. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM GERMANY USING UPS ACCOUNT 02W93E, JUMINGO GMBH, 4 BRESLAUER PLATZ, KOELN GERMANY 50668.

  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH AND WE COULD HEAR DRY ICE PELLETS ROLLING AROUND IN THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING USED TO COOL THE FOOD. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. RESPONDED TO (54) AIR PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING USED TO COOL THE FOOD. item.description:
Report E-2025060037

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0156 ET, Tom Bylina with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCA. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of "Cadox M-50A" were released from a cardboard box (possibly plastic jugs inside) due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon UN3105 Cadox M-50A product released to the concrete dock floor due to forklift puncture impacting 5â€™x5â€™ area. The contractors broke down the pallet to remove the damaged containers and any impacted packaging material. The crew generated (2) 55-gallon poly drums and (1) 35-gallon poly drum containing the damaged plastic pails, oil dri, and impacted packaging material. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

Cameron stated the freight shifted during transit and another pallet struck a pallet containi ng 5-gallon buckets of UN1866, Resin Solution, 3, PG I. Cameron stated one of the 5-gallon buckets on top of the pallet was punctured on the side resulting in a 2-gallon spillage onto the trailer floor.

item.description:
Report X-2025050324

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-05
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This was a return shipment of a lawnmower. It was placed in the shipping box upside down and the gas cap was loose. It leaked gasoline onto and in the shipping box and was noticed as it was being loaded into a trailer during the Outbound Sort. it was brought to the hazmat cage. Using FAST, we tried to locate a phone number for the shipper. The phone number we found for Nematulah was disconnected. We tried to find another phone number. Numerous attempts at possible relatives proved futile. All the phone numbers were disconnected and no longer in service. We contacted Amerisun to see if they had a phone number for Nematulah based on the P.O. number on the barcode. Amerisun said that even though they showed as the original shipper, they had no record of the P.O. and that it was purchased through a third party vendor and they had no information.

  • Description: Beth Wilson, SCM, called Safety to report a spill in trailer 89203 of UN1814, POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE, SOLUTION, 8, PG II, BULK PKG (Tote). Beth stated it looked to be 8 oz of the product spilled onto the trailer floor when the forklift operator struck the top of the tote with the forks on the forklift while unloading other freight in the trailer. Beth stated the tote is not actively spilling and the spill is contained to the trailer in dock door 21. Cura was called to assist in a tote transfer and to clean the trailer floor.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 5, 2025, one (1) 15-gallon drum of UN2014 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the site. The crew secured the loose cap for further shipment of the product. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 5-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025050311
item.description:
Report X-2025050311

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-04
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Forklift driver punctured 1 tote when moving freight. Maree Montoya, 120/ABQ Operations Supervisor, reported 330 Gallons from 1 tote spilled on dock floor due to a forklift operator puncturing the tote. A crew from Environmental Restoration arrived. Crews placed absorbent pads and absorbent booms t o contain the release on the loading dock. Environmental Restoration personnel utilized a shop-vac to collect freestanding liquid throughout the release site. Environmental Restoration personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Crews utilized a s hop-vac to transfer the remaining contents of the damaged tote into 55-gallon drums. All alcoholic beverage-impacted material was collected and containerized in five (5) 55-gallon drums and staged on-site for further management. ER personnel noted no further actions required on-site and crews demobi lized.

Cura was contacted for remediation.

item.title: Report E-2025060023
item.description:
Report E-2025060023

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-02
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2237 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UDV. It was reported that approximately 1 oz of "ConvoClean Forte" was released from 2 plastic jugs due to a packaging defect. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3214872. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately (5) 2.5-gallons of UN1814 ConvoClean Fote product released to the wooden trailer floor and concrete dock floor impacting area 10â€™x10â€™ area. The contractors found multiple cartons on a pallet, must jugs were intact but the cartons were impacted. There were (5) drums generated, (1) 95-gallon poly drum containing damaged bottles, (1) 55-gallon poly drum with damaged bottles, (2) 55-poly drums containing damaged cardboard, and (1) 35-gallon poly drum with damaged cardboard. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 05/02/2025, at 16:35 hours, personnel in the CSXT Fostoria, Ohio Yard discovered SIRX525280, a loaded hopper car of Ferrous Sulfate, leaking from the A-end slide gate. The car was isolated and the shipper, SEM Minerals, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025-05-02-00202). SPSI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the A-end slide gate open approximately 1-2â€ and spilling product. Contractor personnel applied plugging material to the slide gate door to secure the leak, as it could not be closed full. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (Keith Mizwicki).

item.title: Report X-2025050629
item.description:
Report X-2025050629

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A GROUP OF PACKAGES THAT WERE WET FROM RAINWATER, AND AMONG THEM A FULLY REGULATED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WERE DISCOVERED BY THE SWEEPER IN UNLOAD-E. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE HAZ-MAT WAS CONTAINED AND SEGREGATED, WITH THE CARTON SHOWING WETTNESS, BUT NO SIGNS OF SPILLAGE, THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 POLY 1-LB CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY A COUPLE OF ROTATIONS, CAUSING A COUPLE OF OUNCES OF THE PRODUCT TO LEAK OUT OF THE BREACH AND REMAIN CONFINED INTERNALLY IN THE BASE OF THE CARTON. THE PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF 2" OR MORE OF KRAFT PAPER AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 32 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2025050652
item.description:
Report X-2025050652

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/1/2025 at approximately 15:45 FedEx DG Administration was notified of an undeclared dangerous goods spill at Toledo, OH station. The package was discovered leaking an unknown substance. Per the safety data sheet for this product, Nu Calgon Tri Pow'r HD, the substance was identified as UN3266 Corrosive Liquid Basic Inorganic n.o.s. The outer package was a fibreboard box that contained a FedEx Pak which contained a 3.8L plastic bottle of the liquid. The station was directed by Dangerous Goods Adminstration to contain the shipment in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

  • Description: A LEAKING PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED IN THE UNLOAD. MULTIPLE PACKAGES WERE LEAKED ONTO BY LIQUID RUNNING ON BOX TRUCK FLOOR FROM THE LEAKING PACKAGE. THIS PACKAGE BEING REPORTED WAS LEAKED ON AND NOT LEAKING. WHILE REPACKAGING SALVAGABLE ITEMS IT WAS FOUND THIS PACKAGE CONTAINED AN INNER BOX BEING MARKED WITH A CLASS 8 CORROSIVE DIAMOND ON TIP, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S, ((Z)-OCTADEC-9-ENYLAMINE),8, PGII, MARINE POLLUTANT. THE HAZMAT HELPLINE WAS CONTACTED AND VERIFIED THIS IS AN UNDECLARED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SHIPMENT.

item.title: Report X-2025051803
item.description:
Report X-2025051803

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: JAMAICA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A three pallet/package shipment was identified as containing undeclared dangerous goods at the FedEx origin station in Jamaica, New York after being transported by surface transport from the station in Newark, New Jersey. When more than two Cordless Robot Pool Cleaners were visible on a single pallet in a consignment of more than two packages, employees noted the lack of 3481 Lithium battery marks on the outer packaging and reported the issue to Dangerous Goods Administration. The shipment was opened to determine the quantities of UN3481 per pallet and audit the contents after it was noted that the Commercial Invoice listed several suspicious entries. Numerous additional UN3481s were discovered along with other undeclared regulated DG contained in the three pallets (flammable aerosols and UN3480s). This shipment has been deemed to be undeclared based on the existence of 2.1s and UN3480s being in this shipment with no indication of their inclusion. The Master Tracking number 880927791184 (and subsidiary tracking numbers 880927791195 and 880927791200) contained a total of 143 inner containers of UN3481, 281 inner containers of flammable aerosol sunscreen, 10 inner containers of flammable aerosol insecticide and 3 stand-alone lithium ion batteries, 1 of which appears to be over 100 watt-hour capacity. The origin station was directed by FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration to hold the shipment pending further disposition instructions.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/1/2025 at approximately 0800, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 457903 at the ramp facility in Boise, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing 4 plastic containers, one of which spilled. Further investigation revealed the commodity as Mil-X disinfectant cleaner. Dangerous Goods Administration obtained a safety data sheet that classified the product as UN1760. Per the agent, the shipment did not have the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork, in accordance with IATA Regulations. The shipment is being, pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report E-2025050201
item.description:
Report E-2025050201

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: SeaTac
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SKYWEST AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A passengerâ€™s personal electronic device (a disposable vape) went into battery thermal runaway. United flight 3393 was waiting in the que for take-off when a passenger sitting in 14 A rang the Flight attendant call button. The Flight attendant reported that visible smoke was spewing from the vape pen intermittently. The device was not designed so that the battery could be removed. The flight attendant took the device which was hot but not so much that it couldnâ€™t be handled. The Flight attendant placed the device in a plastic bucket and submerged it in water. The device continued to expel smoke under water. The duration of release was not specified. The flight attendant informed the pilot in command of the situation and the flight returned to the gate while still on the ground. At the gate the device was removed from the aircraft, placed in a fire containment bag, submerged again under water until the device cooled down. The national response center was notified shortly after the event was reported.

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN LOADER ON THE PD-2. HE NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISER, WHO CONTACTED THE DMP. WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 1 GLASS, 2.5 LITER BOTTLE WAS LOOSE BY A COUPLE OF ROTATIONS, CAUSING THE LIQUID TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO AN INTERNAL PLASTIC BAG AND SIDE WALL OF THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING CONSISTED OF MOLDED FIBERBOARD AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL BIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report E-2025050266
item.description:
Report E-2025050266

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04/30/2025 at 0632 hours, personnel in the CSXT Yard in Rigby Yard, Portland, ME discovered TILX101251, a loaded tank car containing spent sulfuric acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated, and Chemtrade Logistics Inc., the shipper, was notified via CHEMTREC (2025-04-30-00081). HEPACO, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found that the railcar had 20 PSI of pressure left on the railcar from the loading process. The securement chain for the liquid line cap was positioned under the cap, and the gasket showed signs of deterioration. Approximately two gallons of product leaked onto the top of the car as a result. Contractor personnel depressurized the railcar, corrected all defects, confirmed appropriate outage, and decontaminated the top of the railcar. The issue and corrected actions were communicated to Blair Hetherington, the representative from Chemtrade Logistics at 250-525-0179, www.chemtradelogistics.com.

item.title: Report E-2025060015
item.description:
Report E-2025060015

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0437 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XCO. It was reported that approximately 20+ gallons (active) of Octave released from a 55-gallon DF due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer # 4416761 at dock door 80. This is an active release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the whole area of the trailer floor and 12-foot by 12-foot area under trailer on asphalt and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. HEPACO personnel removed all cargo from trailer neutralizing cargo with soda ash and water. The trailer floor and asphalt below the trailer was neutralized with soda ash/ water and absorbent material then swept up the impacted absorbent material. The damaged drum was placed into one (1) 85-gallon overpacked drum and recovered material was placed into four (4) 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the XPO team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: At 18:10 PM ET, Alex Ramirez with ULB contacted the call center to request help with a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Carson, CA. The spill consists of approximately 3 gallons of Brake Cleaner, which released from 1â€“55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture prior to arrival. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist at this is a 6.1 release. The spill is contained to the inside of the trailer. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of UN1992 Brake Cleaner released to the pallet and a trailer floor due to forklift puncture. The crew overpacked the 55-gallon drum into a 95-gallon poly drum, the impacted pallet was containerized in a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 0350 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UPO 2. It was reported that approximately 1-liter of an unknown hazmat product released from a cardboard box due to packaging failure. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of UN3265 Ecolab Smartpower Sink & Surface Clean Sanitiz released to the pallet and a 3â€™x8â€™ area of the concrete dock due to improper loading. The crew containerized the impacted pallet in a 55-gallon poly drum and wiped up the spilled material The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Called Chemtrec and spoke to Chris. Report #2025042400244. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately .5 gallons of UN2927 Diquat SPC released to 3â€™x3â€™ area of the concrete dock floor due to forklift puncture. The crew deployed oil-dri onto the impacted spilled product and then cleaned with absorbents and neutralized the concrete, the pallet was cutup, impacted cardboard, poly bottles, waste was containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025050429
item.description:
Report E-2025050429

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-24
  • City: KENT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Facility personnel showing up in the morning noticed material leaking from the back of the trailer onto the pavement. They put down absorbents to contain the material and call the companies emergency response number 0500et. A team was dispatched and arrived on scene at 1100et. The team put on the proper ppe and began addressing the release and making entry into the trailer. The container was accessed and it was found to be under extreme pressure and they backed out to regroup at 1300et. It was at this time 911 was called and the fire department/HM response team arrived. They applied water to the drum to cool it down to stop the expansion of the container. The drum was cooled down and the fire department/HM response left and was determined that the container was to be monitored overnight before placing into a salvage drum. The team monitored the temperature until 1100et on 4/25/25 at which time the drum was deemed safe to handle and place into a Salvage drum. Once the drum was placed into the salvage drum the rest of the material that was in the trailer floor and on the pavement was cleaned up and disposed of appropriately for disposal. The scene was compleat and the crews were done by 1600et.

item.title: Report X-2025050664
item.description:
Report X-2025050664

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-23
  • City: MARION
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the remediation of NWRU 357509, yard personnel advised me of a second container, NWRU 357412, which was found releasing. Upon investigation, approximately 25 gallons was released to the ground. The concrete was remediated, and the doors were packed with pads so that the container could be moved to a separate location to be reworked. One E3 personnel monitored the trailer until daylight hours. E3 returned and found the container with (12) 275-gallon totes, ten on the floor and the front two double stacked and secured with a ratchet strap. This double stacking caused the bottom two to be crushed which resulted in a release from one of the totes. E3 removed the totes, deconned each one, transferred the four front totes and remediated the well car and the release to the ground. The shipper agency was contacted, and a third container was requested for the four totes that were double stacked and the waste. KOCU 212290 was in the Marion Yd already and was loaded with the four totes, the empty totes, and the collected waste.

item.title: Report X-2025050663
item.description:
Report X-2025050663

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-22
  • City: MARION
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 35000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon notification, I contacted yard ops who advised the release was from the rear of the trailer and running all over the concrete. Marion FD was contacted to respond. Code 3 had limited crews so E3 was requested from Memphis and was able to respond personnel and equipment. HMM arrived at 1454 and the leak was a steady drip at the back doors of NWRU 357509. Upon opening the container doors, the load was blocked and braced and contained (12) 275-gallon totes. Ten of which were on the floor and the front two were double stacked and secured with a ratchet strap. This resulted in the bottom two totes being crushed. The cage on both broke with one puncturing the tote and releasing an estimated 30 gallons total. E3 removed the totes, deconned each one, transferred the four front totes and remediated the well car and the release to the ground. The shipper agency was contacted, and a third container was requested for the four totes that were double stacked and the waste. KOCU 212290 was in the Marion Yd already and was loaded with the four totes, the empty totes, and the collected waste.

item.title: Report E-2025040567
item.description:
Report E-2025040567

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-22
  • City: KENT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the concrete dock floor. The terminal estimated two (2) ounces of material was released due to a forklift damaging one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. Clean Harbors used an air compressor to flip the tote over because it was on its side. Granular absorbents were deployed to the affected areas and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining product was transferred to one (1) 330-gallon poly tote. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized into one 55-gallon plastic box. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal

  • City: GREENSBORO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Loaded car TELX 49036 was delivered to customer facility, Stockhausen Superabsorber, LCC with active leak from lquid line valve. Delivery occurred at night and spillage was only one side of car therefore conductor did not detect presence of the leak. Customer facility personnel found leak after crew departed area and reported it Norfolk Southern. Customer reported the plug on the liquid valve was tool tight but was corroded and had an insufficient amount of thread tape. Liquid was observed between the ball valve and the plug. Customer report an excessive amount of pressure on the car but could not provide a pressure reading.

item.title: Report X-2025051393
item.description:
Report X-2025051393

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 30000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04.21.2025, a CN transportation employee observed tank car, GATX217272, Load, UN1760, to be leaking from the bottom at the Woodstock Yard, Memphis, TN. All appropriate notifications made. DGO Vaughan responded to the Woodstock Yard and conducted an inspection of the tank car. A slow leak was discharging from the area inside the skid protection housing, above the BOV flanged nozzle and cap. The BOV cap and BOV valve handle were confirmed to be tool-tight and fully closed. Due to the skid protection covering plate and BOV flanged nozzle design, the BOV could not be inspected to determine the cause of the leak. The leak was contained, and the tank cars' contents were transloaded into tank car # GATX37296, which was sourced from within the CN Woodstock yard. The tank car was then cleaned and purged of all hazardous materials.

DURING PACKAGE INSPECTION THERE ARE FOUR CONTAINERS EACH AT ONE GALLON CAPACITY EACH INDIVIDUALLY BAGGED. ONE CONTAINER HAS LEAKED INSIDE THE BAG AND HAS SEEPED FROM THE BAG INTO THE FIBERBOARD BOX. THE PRODUCT IS PPG SPORTS COATINGS PROKOTE 230056GB URETHANE HARDENER. THE OUTER BOX IS UN SPECIFICATION WITH APPROPRIATELY APPLIED DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS AND LABELS. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY.

  • Description: At 0351 EDT on 4/19, XPO-XTM contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 pounds of Potassium Perchlorate from two 50lb plastic bags onto the trailer floor. The bags were improperly loaded and damaged from BCH. The material is a class 5.1 and ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-pounds of UN1489 Potassium Perchlorate released to a 6â€™x6â€™ wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The crew containerized the (2) bags of product into (1) 55-gallon poly drum/vented and (1) 55-gallon poly drum containing impacted PPE/wetted. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025050292
item.description:
Report E-2025050292

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: BIRDSBORO
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1230 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XRQ. It was reported that approximately 25 gallons of UN1760 KE-611 concentrated high alkaline detergent and smoke remover (Sodium hydroxide) released from 55-gallon poly drum due to being puncture. The release impacted trailer # 4350037. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed an approximately 25-gallons of UN1760 KE-611 released to 40â€™x10â€™ of wooden trailer due to a forklift puncture. The crew thoroughly cleaned impacted surfaces with granular absorbents and soda ash and tested PH neutral. The damaged drum was overpacked into a 95-gallon poly drum, (4) 55-gallon poly drums contain neutralized impacted absorbents and pallet pieces. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 19:54 PM ET, BCA contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Carlisle, PA. The spill consists of approximately 2 cups of Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate, which released from (1) 50-pound paper bag due to a forklift puncture during loading. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal. A contractor will be dispatched as this is a corrosive solid release. Lewis Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) cups of material was released due to forklift damaging (1) paper bag. Lewis Environmental personnel moved all the plastic bags from the pallet to verify only one (1) bag was damaged and then swept up the released material. The damaged bags and recovered material were placed into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025050194
item.description:
Report E-2025050194

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-11
  • City: MANCHESTER
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AVELO AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Flight Attendants were just chimed for final descent into the Manchester Boston Regional Airport. Shortly after Customer noticed smoke coming from the side pocket of her backpack that was stowed underneath the seat in front of her. The Customer pulled the e-cigarette out of the backpack and tried to cover it as she went to the aft galley.Â  The device was hot to touch and had smoke coming from it. FA2 immediately notified the lead flight attendant, and then the lead notified the captain of the situation. Flight Attendants initially grabbed the Libik Kit but then decided as a group that given the phase of flight the best course of action was to submerge the device in water in the sink of the aft lav and locked the door. Lead Flight Attendant then notified the captain that the situation was under control and the device would continue to be monitored. Upon arrival at the gate Airport Ops was notified and device was handed over. No injuries were reported.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-02
  • City: BALTIMORE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Circle K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 60-gallons of gasoline released to a 1500 square foot area of asphalt parking lot due to the driver overfilling the tank and the the flapper, failed to engage and prevent the release of fuel. ERTS dispatched HEPACO to he site to perform cleanup. HEPACO deployed absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the collected material into four, 55-gallon metal drums for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal bucket due to the container being damaged and leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the spill themselves. They gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050004
item.description:
Report E-2025050004

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-02
  • City: HARLINGEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1244 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LHG. It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of Hydrolchloric Acid released from 2) 1 gallon poly jugs due to faulty seal on the containers. The release impacted trailer # 3152072. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Per SCM Steven Solis terminal is capable of the cleanup activities. The terminal placed the waste in a 10-gallon poly drum.

ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who confirmed they were comfortable cleaning the spill with PPE per the SDS. 232505-1 - 10-gallon DM containing 1 box of 4 1-gallon metal cans of Sea Foam Motor Treatment Chemtrec# 2024040200006.
